fields.value: Replication data for: Candidate Selection in Chile Project

dsDescriptionValue.value: This project collaborative with Peter Siavelis (Wake Forest University), examines the career trajectories of successful and unsuccessful candidates for the Chilean Congress to identify the strategies that party and coalition leaders use in order to recruit high-quality candidates to undertake risky electoral campaigns.

publicationCitation.value: Carey, John M. 2005. "Candidate Selection in Chile Project." Carey data archive. www.dartmouth.edu/~jcarey project available here
Carey, John M. 2005. "Candidate Selection in Chile Project." Carey data archive. www.dartmouth.edu/~jcarey project available here

“Las virtudes del sistema binominal” (“The virtue of M=2”). Revista de ciencia política 26(1): 226-235 (Santiago, Chile). August 2006.“ article available here

“Election Insurance and Coalition Survival: Formal and Informal Institutions in Chile” Co-authored with Peter Siavelis. Informal Institutions and Democracy: Lessons from Latin America. Gretchen Helmke and Steven Levitsky, eds. Baltimore, MD: Johns Hopkins University Press, 2006: 160-177. book available here

“Insurance for good losers and the survival of Chile’s Concertacion” Co-authored with Peter Siavelis. Latin American Politics and Society 47(2):1-22. Summer 2005. article available here
